definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions

sentences.english: Republicans in Congress are already complaining about the scale of public spending.
sentences.chinese: 而国会的共和党人已经在抱怨公共开支的规模。

sentences.english: He saw cutting public spending as another priority.
sentences.chinese: 他将裁减公共开支看为另一项重中之重。

sentences.english: But our government has a propitiously debonair attitude to public spending.
sentences.chinese: 但我们的政府对于公共开支有极为殷勤的态度。

definition: measures of national income and output
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
